intro: Erigeron strigosus f. discoideus, commonly known as the woolly fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its hairy, gray-green foliage and daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as meadows and rocky areas, preferring well-drained soils. Its flowers bloom in the summer, producing white petals with a yellow center, and it is often found in the western United States. The species is noted for its ornamental value and its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
